glosses: A set of food containers that can be fastened on top of each other for easy transport during camping or in the military.
A single container in such a set.

etymology: Compound of sefer (“expedition, campaign, journey”) + tas (“bowl, vessel, container”) + -ı (possessive suffix), inherited from Ottoman Turkish سفر طاسی (sefer tası, “a lunchbox of several dishes of metal fitting upon each other, the whole being fastened together so as to be carried like a single utensil”).
